value.title: AI ethics: The future of AI could become scary
value.excerpt: A Gartner report says the consequences of widespread AI will have huge effects on our society. Logistics dispatches AI, drones, and robots to haul the industry into the future 8:41 Cybersecurity pros can't handle all the threat tasks alone,

value.title: South Korean AI technology brings back folk singer's voice
value.excerpt: Even though South Korean folk rock singer Kim Kwang-seok has been dead for nearly 25 years, his fans will be able to hear him perform a new song cover on Friday thanks to artificial intelligence (AI) technology used to recreate his voice.

value.title: The ethics of the metaverse
value.excerpt: Into the Metaverse online event with Hendrik Lesser, CEO of Remote Control Productions, about the ethics of the metaverse, the universe of virtual worlds that are all interconnected, like in novels such as Snow Crash and Ready Player One.

value.title: World Economic Forum launches global alliance to speed adoption of trustworthy AI
value.excerpt: The World Economic Forum is launching the Global AI Action Alliance today with over 100 organizations participating.

value.title: AI Ethics Really Come Down To Security
value.excerpt: If we're going to rely on them to take more active and responsible roles in our lives, we must be able to trust that they're not only ethical but that the AI and the machine learning that underpins them operate safely and securely.

value.title: Humans wouldn't be able to control a superintelligent AI, according to a new study
value.excerpt: Not only does the research suggest humans wouldn't be able to control machines — we may not even know when superintelligent machines have arrived.

value.title: Leading HR Technology Company launches AI Ethics Advisory Board

value.title: Digital Trends 2021: Responsible Business Puts Trust, Ethics, And Sustainability First
value.excerpt: This year’s digital technology predictions from industry analysts reveal trending people-centric exigencies for brand trust, ethical responsibility, and sustainability.

value.title: South Korea has used AI to bring a dead superstar's voice back to the stage, but ethical concerns abound
value.excerpt: National broadcaster SBS plans to use artificial intelligence (AI) to bring Kim's voice back to life on a new program, "Competition of the Century: AI vs Human," to air later this week.

value.title: Gartner: The future of AI is not as rosy as some might think
value.excerpt: A Gartner report predicts that the second-order consequences of widespread AI will have massive societal impacts, to the point of making us unsure if and when we can trust our own eyes.

value.title: Learning with — and about — AI technology
value.excerpt: MIT Media Lab Personal Robots group head Cynthia Breazeal joined MIT Education Arcade Director Eric Klopfer for a conversation about AI's role in K-12 education as part of a new webinar series from MIT Open Learning.

value.title: Center for Applied Data Ethics suggests treating AI like a bureaucracy – Jaweb
value.excerpt: A recent paper from the Center for Applied Data Ethics (CADE) at the University of San Francisco urges AI practitioners to adopt terms from anthropology when reviewing the performance of large machine learning models.

value.title: Center for Applied Data Ethics suggests treating AI like a bureaucracy
value.excerpt: A new research paper suggests AI practitioners adopt anthropology terms to assess large machine learning models that harm people.

value.title: Sen. Sherrod Brown files ethics complaint against Ted Cruz, Josh Hawley
value.excerpt: Sen. Sherrod Brown of Ohio has joined several Democrats in filing a Senate Ethics Committee complaint against Republican Senators Ted Cruz and Josh Hawley.

value.title: What Nonprofits Stand To Gain From Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: Nonprofits have the opportunity to develop AI powerful algorithms to raise more funds, improve the efficiency of their resources and learn more about their members' needs.

value.title: AI Systems to get an Ethics Code: DoD
value.excerpt: Ethical considerations will go into Artificial Intelligence (AI)’s design and employment because it enables autonomy, decision making and system execution at incredibly fast speeds, a DoD official said.

value.title: Ethics and Governance of AI
value.excerpt: The rapidly growing capabilities and increasing presence of AI-based systems in our lives raise pressing questions about the impact, governance, ethics, and accountability of these technologies around the world. How can we narrow the knowledge gap between ...

value.title: New Google union ‘concerned’ after a senior A.I. ethics researcher is reportedly locked out of her account
value.excerpt: The Alphabet Workers Union has said it is concerned over Google's decision to lock Margaret Mitchell, a senior AI ethics researcher, out of her account.

value.title: New Google union condemns investigation of AI ethics researcher
value.excerpt: A union of workers at Google and its parent company Alphabet is condemning Google's investigation of an AI ethics researcher.

value.title: Google union slams company’s treatment of AI ethics researchers
value.excerpt: The Alphabet Workers Union said the actions against Margaret Mitchell and Timnit Gebru "call into question Google’s commitment to ethics."

value.title: Metaethics, Meta-Intelligence And The Rise Of AI
value.excerpt: With every new major transformation at a societal level driven by technology, there will be new concerns and challenges.

value.title: This Chinese Lab Is Aiming for Big AI Breakthroughs
value.excerpt: China produces as many artificial intelligence researchers as the US, but it lags in key fields like machine learning. The government hopes to make up ground.

value.title: Google and its ethics AI team row: What we know so far
value.excerpt: Google has drawn major criticism on the move of sudden investigation of Mitchell and suspension of her system access.

value.title: Google investigates ethical AI team member over handling of sensitive data
value.excerpt: Alphabet Inc’s Google is investigating a member of its ethical AI team and has locked the corporate account linked to that person after finding that thousands of files were retrieved from its server and shared with external accounts,

value.title: Google targets AI ethics lead Margaret Mitchell after firing Timnit Gebru
value.excerpt: Margaret Mitchell leads the Google AI ethics team following the firing of Timnit Gebru. Now Google said Mitchell is under investigation.

value.title: Incoming White House science and technology leader on AI, diversity, and society
value.excerpt: Incoming White House science and technology leader Dr. Alondra Nelson addressed the relationship between AI development an inclusion.
